title: How can an object lose momentum, but maintain motion, especially if the collision stops the object? - Quora

response.answer_text: It depends on a frictionless surface or not, meaning net force, but if for example you have ice which has very low friction than yeah in special cases collision doesn’t stop an object it either moves with the other object or moves in the opposite direction to where it was heading before the collision

How can an object lose momentum, but maintain motion, Friction can slow it down. Drag can slow it down. A force can slow it down, as an object moving upward from the earth. especially if the collision stops the object? Well, if it stops the object, motion is not maintained, by definition.
